citation.article-title: Comparative sequence analyses of the 16S rRNA genes of Lactobacillus minutus, Lactobacillus rimae and Streptococcus parvulus: proposal for the creation of a new genus Atopobium.

p.s: Atopobium (a.to.po'bi.um.. Gr. adj. atopos, having no place. strange: Gr. neu. part. used as noun: bion, living thing: N.L. neu. n.: Atopobion strange living thing)
Cells consist of short rods, often with central swellings, or small cocci that may appear to be elliptical.
Cells occur singly, in pairs, and in short chains, and are Gram-positive, non-motile, nonsporeforming, obligately anaerobic.
The major fermentation products produced from glucose are lactic acid, together with acetic and formic acids; trace amounts of succinic acid may also be formed.
Growth may or may not occur in 6.5% NaCl.
Gelatin is not liquefied, meat is not digested. indole is not produced, and nitrate is not reduced.
The G +C content of DNA is 35-46 mol%.
The type species is Atopobium minutum.
